p: Out of total 1683 suspected cases for having influenza infection, we identified influenza viruses from 614 (36.5%) cases ( Figure 3). Influenza type A accounted for 364 (59.3%) cases of infection whereas influenza type B was found in 248 (40.4%) cases. More than half number of patients 313 (51.0%) were found infected with influenza A/H3 strain alone. Among the 248 cases of influenza B infection, 106 isolates were further differentiated into lineage which revealed higher number of viruses from B/Yamagata lineage (11.1%) in comparison to B/Victoria lineage (6.2%). Interestingly, co-infection of influenza B and influenza A/H3 strain was found in two cases during the period of study ( Table 2).
